c74object.name: bufresample~
c74object.digest: Resample the contents of a buffer~ to transpose or change sample rate
c74object.description: bufresample~ can perform resampling either for the purpose of transposition or in order to change the sample rate. A source buffer~ can be processed to arbitrary transposition (ratios) and sample rates (Hz). The results can be written to a new buffer~ or be applied in-place. Resampling is performed through a standard kaiser-windowed sinc-resampled filter which can be independently specified.

inlet.digest: The resample, transpose, both and filter messages
inlet.description: The resample, transpose and both messages perform resampling and transposition. The filter message generates filter settings.

outlet.digest: Bang on completion of the requested process

method.name: both
method.digest: Resampling for transposition and sample rate simultaneously
method.description:
Syntax: both <symbol: target_buffer> <symbol: source_buffer> [<float: transposition_ratio>] [<int/float: target_sample_rate>]
The both operation performs both transposition and sample rate changing of the source buffer~ to a transposition and a new sample rate specified by the third and fourth arguments to the message respectively.
Processes are performed through the resampling filter (see the filter method). If no transposition or new sample rate are invoked by the given arguments then the source buffer is simply copied to the target buffer.
both defaults: target buffer symbol / source buffer symbol / 1.0 (must be > 0.01) / native sample rate of file loaded into buffer~.

method.name: filter
method.description:
Syntax: filter [<int: zero_xings>] [<int: points>] [<float: frequency>] [<float: alpha>]
The filter message takes four arguments to set up the resampling filter for use with the resample, transpose and both methods:
number of zero-crossings / number of points (half size) / centre frequency (normalised) / alpha.
This produces a standard kaiser-windowed sinc-resampled filter. The message filter alone uses defaults (see below).
filter defaults: 10 (min 1, max 512) / 16384 (min 16, max 16384) / 0.455 (min 0.0, max 1.0) / 11.0 (must be > 0.0).

method.name: resample
method.digest: Perform resampling for sample rate changes
method.description:
Syntax: resample <symbol: target_buffer> <symbol: source_buffer> [<int/float: target_sample_rate>]
The resample operation performs resampling of the source buffer~ to a new sample rate specified by the third argument to the message, without adjusting for transposition. Resampling is performed through the resampling filter (see the filter method).
The target_sample_rate argument is specified with a Hz sample rate value. If the given sample rate does not require any resampling the source buffer is simply copied to the target buffer.
resample defaults: target buffer symbol / source buffer symbol / native sample rate of file loaded into buffer~.

method.name: transpose
method.description:
Syntax: transpose <symbol: target_buffer> <symbol: source_buffer> [<float: transposition_ratio>]
The transpose method performs simple resampling based transposition of the source buffer~ without accounting for sample rate changes. Transposition is performed through the resampling filter (see the filter method).
The transposition_ratio argument is specified by ratio (1.0 being no transposition). If the given ratio does not invoke any transposition the source buffer is simply copied to the target buffer.
transpose defaults: target buffer symbol / source buffer symbol / 1.0 (must be > 0.01).

c74object.discussion: bufresample~ uses SIMD instructions for optimal speed where available. Processing occurs in the defered thread, but the outlet generates a bang when the called process is complete, so that it can be used in realtime situations where applicable. See the helpfile for examples.
